thread.title: Grant Thornton names Greg Wallig as Metro DC Office Managing Partner

author: cnbc.com
title: Grant Thornton names Greg Wallig as Metro DC Office Managing Partner

organizations.name: public sector and washington national tax office

text:
WASHINGTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Grant Thornton LLP has named Greg Wallig as the firm’s Metro DC office managing partner. In this role, he will focus on client service, growth and talent development in the nation’s capital.
This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20180205005005/en/
Greg Wallig (Photo: Business Wire)
“Greg has had an impressive 13-year career at Grant Thornton -- one during which he has worked successfully across multiple geographies, service lines and industries,” said Sean Denham, Grant Thornton’s Atlantic Coast regional managing partner. “He brings remarkable leadership qualities and significant experience in advisory engagements that will foster continued success for our clients.”
Wallig will serve as office managing partner for the firm’s Metro DC office, located in Arlington, Virginia, and will work closely with leaders from the firm’s Public Sector and Washington National Tax Office. He succeeds Jamie Fowler in the office managing partner role, who now serves as the firm’s national managing partner of Tax Services.
Wallig joined Grant Thornton in 2005, starting in the firm’s San Francisco office. He spent five years as leader of the Public Sector Risk Advisory service line, and also helped to found the Public Sector Audit practice, serving as that practice’s first Information Assurance leader. For the past three years, Wallig led the firm’s Advisory practice in Bangalore, India, which grew exponentially during that time. He has served as the Advisory Services Regional Leader for the Atlantic Coast for the past 18 months.
A resident of Arlington, Wallig serves on the Board of the Masters of Science in Business Analytics program at the College of William & Mary, where he received his bachelor’s degree. He is a Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), and he is Certified in the Governance of Enterprise IT (CGEIT).
About Grant Thornton LLP
Founded in Chicago in 1924, Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton) is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd, one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms. Grant Thornton, which has revenues in excess of $1.7 billion and operates 59 offices, works with a broad range of dynamic publicly and privately held companies, government agencies, financial institutions, and civic and religious organizations.
“Grant Thornton” refers to Grant Thornton LLP, the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd (GTIL). GTIL and the member firms are not a worldwide partnership. Services are delivered by the member firms. GTIL and its member firms are not agents of, and do not obligate, one another and are not liable for one another’s acts or omissions.
